org.liris.smartgov.simulator.core.agent.moving.behavior

Class MovingBehavior

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.liris.smartgov.simulator.core.agent.core.behavior.Behavior<MoverAction>
      • org.liris.smartgov.simulator.core.agent.moving.behavior.MovingBehavior
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GeoMovingBehavior

    public abstract class MovingBehavior
extends Behavior<MoverAction>
    An abstract Behavior implementation for agents moving in the simulation.

    Such behavior is defined by an origin and a destination between which the agents associated to this behavior should move.

    Notice that, from a model point of view, the agent should be given a MovingBehavior once, at instantiation time, or if it needs to be completely reinitialized, aka if its behavior change.

    When the Agent has reached its destination, it is more consistent to refresh() its behavior than associating a new MovingBehavior to it.

    The Behavior.provideAction() function will provide only MoverActions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovingBehavior

        public MovingBehavior(MovingAgentBody agentBody,
                      Node origin,
                      Node destination,
                      SmartGovContext context)
        MovingBehavior constructor. Uses distances as default costs to refresh the behavior.

        Notice that this default cost is quite inefficient, because it doesn't use any heuristic, even if it uses the generic arc length.

        Parameters:
        agentBody - AgentBody of the Agent to which this Behavior will be associated. In practice, this reference is used by updateAgentBodyPlan().
        origin - Initial origin
        destination - Initial destination
        context - Current context. Used by updateAgentBodyPlan() to compute the new AgentBody's Plan.

        origin - Initial origin
        destination - Initial destination
        context - Current context. Used by updateAgentBodyPlan() to compute the new AgentBody's Plan.
        costs - AStar costs used to compute the shortest path between origin and destination

      • updateAgentBodyPlan

        public void updateAgentBodyPlan()
        Updates the AgentBody's Plan according to the current origin and destination.

        Computes the shortest path from origin to destination, and update the AgentBody's Plan with the computed nodes, using the costs specified in the constructor, set by setCosts(org.liris.smartgov.simulator.core.environment.graph.astar.Costs) or the default distances costs if no costs were provided.

        The Behavior doesn't directly have a reference to the current Plan, because the behavior actually just represents the will of the agent to go from the origin to the destination.

        So it might look inconsistent to update the AgentBody's Plan from the Behavior : the Plan should be updated externally, according to the Behavior. This is completely true, however this is done there because it is easier for the user to automatically update the Plan each time the #refresh() method is called. Otherwise, one could either forget to update the AgentBody's Plan after a behavior refresh, or, worse, externally compute a Plan with origin and destination that doesn't correspond to the behavior.

      • refresh

        public void refresh(Node origin,
                    Node destination)
        Updates the current behavior with the specified origin and destination. Also updates the AgentBody's Plan accordingly, with the shortest path from origin to destination.
        Parameters:
        origin - new origin
        destination - new destination
